Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC LINE ID: A unique identifier for a seismic line.
Column Comment.2: SEISMIC POINT ID: Unique identifier for each seismic point
Column Comment.3: SEIS SHOT POINT SURVEY OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for eachposition in the survey for a point in a line. Many points may be referenced to a well fora take-off to a well site, for example.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: AZIMUTH: Bearing of the offset distance from the reference point to the surveystation, clockwise from the azimuth north.
Column Comment.6: AZIMUTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The original units of measure used.may be radians, decimal degrees, Degrees - minutes - seconds.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EAST-WEST DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid East-West directions.For example, East, West.
Column Comment.9: EAST WEST DISTANCE: The distance from the reference point to the survey stationin an east west direction.
Column Comment.10: EAST WEST DISTANCE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.11: EAST-WEST START LINE: The east-west starting lines for offset distances. Thesedescriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such as Texassurveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FEL (first east line),NEL (northmost east line),...
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.13: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of obj ect being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.14: MONUMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to the monument.
Column Comment.15: MONUMENT SUPPORT FACILTY SUBTYPE; Part of the FK from SF MONUMENT.
Column Comment.16: NORTH TYPE: The North reference used in surveying to define angularmeasurements. For example, True North, Magnetic North, Grid North, AstronomicalNorth, ...
Column Comment.17: NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid north-southDirections. For example, North, South.
Column Comment.18: NORTH SOUTH DISTANCE: the distance of the seismic station from the monumentor node in a north south direction, as specified by the direction foreign key.
Column Comment.19: NORTH SOUTH DISTANCE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.20: NORTH-SOUTH START LINE: The north-south starting lines for offset distances.These descriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such asTexas surveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FSL (first southline), ESL (eastmost south line), ...
Column Comment.21: ORIENTATION: The orientation of measurements to reference lines. For example,parallel, perpendicular, ...
Column Comment.22: POINT OFFSET: radial distance from the reference point to the survey station.
Column Comment.23: POINT OFFSET ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The original units of measureused.
Column Comment.24: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.25: REFERENCE LOCATION: Description of the starting point for metes and boundsmeasurements. Typically the legal description of the corner. e.g. SE12-80-05-W5M,which represents the SE corner of section 12, township 80, range 5, West of the 5thMeridian in the DLS system. Similar constructs can be developed for the other legalsurvey systems.
Column Comment.26: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.27: SOURCE: The individual, company, agency, application or other source designatedas the source of information for this row.
Column Comment.28: SURFACE LOCATION: location description for the surface seismic position.
Column Comment.29: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
